content:
# It seems that the `ensure_craftable` function is not defined in the current context. This indicates that I need to manually check my inventory and craft the required items instead of relying on that utility function.

# Since I have harvested coal, I should now check my inventory to see what I have and what I need to craft a stone furnace.

# First, I will inspect my inventory to see how much coal and other materials I have.
player_inventory = inspect_inventory()

# I need to check if I have enough stone and coal to craft the stone furnace. 
# A stone furnace requires 5 stone and 1 coal.
stone_needed = 5
coal_needed = 1

# Check current inventory
current_stone = player_inventory.get(Prototype.Stone, 0)
current_coal = player_inventory.get(Prototype.Coal, 0)

# Now I will determine if I can craft the stone furnace.
if current_stone >= stone_needed and current_coal >= coal_needed:
    # I can craft the stone furnace
    craft_item(Prototype.StoneFurnace, quantity=1)
else:
    # I need to gather more resources
    if current_stone < stone_needed:
        # Gather stone
        stone_position = nearest(Resource.Stone)
        move_to(stone_position)
        harvest_resource(stone_position, quantity=stone_needed - current_stone)  # Gather the remaining stone needed

    if current_coal < coal_needed:
        # Gather more coal if needed
        coal_position = nearest(Resource.Coal)
        move_to(coal_position)
        harvest_resource(coal_position, quantity=coal_needed - current_coal)  # Gather the remaining coal needed

# After ensuring I have enough resources, I will attempt to craft the stone furnace again.
